{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3351259,"name":"Myer","username":"myer","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/myer/{size}/217120_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-03T12:24:28.490Z","cooked":"

We are using PathPlanner for all our autos this year, and it has been wonderful aside for the small bugs. I have a weird problem that I can’t track down, which is that there is a random delay between commands being run. When running the routine, the bot appears to just sit there idle for a good ~5 seconds before running the next command.

image1514×1728 204 KB

This is the full routine, and our code for the named commands is here: CRESCENDO-2024/src/main/java/frc/robot/RobotContainer.java at b5a1b9060a16e5132511f0164b08133ce571605f · RambotsTeam1350/CRESCENDO-2024 · GitHub

If anyone has any suggestions, please let me know. The delay occurs between the robot following the path and “ARSTSA” (“Auto Rotate Shooter To Speaker Angle”).

| Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/pathplanner-auto-random-delays/461154/1","custom_user_title":"1350 | Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3351268,"name":"Isaac","username":"isaacngkh","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/i/e9a140/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-04-03T12:31:07.844Z","cooked":"

It sounds like commands not ending. Make sure all the command ends, and/or have timeouts. For example, Intake Down does not have time out and has to wait for PID to be at goal.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2024-04-03T12:31:07.844Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":90,"readers_count":89,"score":23.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":461154,"topic_slug":"pathplanner-auto-random-delays","display_username":"Isaac","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":63578,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/pathplanner-auto-random-delays/461154/2","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3351273,"name":"NewtonCrosby","username":"NewtonCrosby","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/ed8c4c/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-04-03T12:37:20.759Z","cooked":"

Intake Note will only end when the PID controller in your IntakeRotation subystem’s PID controller is with 1.5 degrees of the setpoint. If you decorated that named command with a timeout you’d probably see the delay go away.

Conversely, you’ll probably need to tune your pids to end more quickly against all sorts of conditions (like sagging battery voltage, etc).

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2024-04-03T12:37:20.759Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":88,"readers_count":87,"score":27.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":461154,"topic_slug":"pathplanner-auto-random-delays","display_username":"NewtonCrosby","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":31346,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/pathplanner-auto-random-delays/461154/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3351274,"name":"Fletch","username":"Fletch1373","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/fletch1373/{size}/220073_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-03T12:37:20.997Z","cooked":"

I agree with @isaacngkh on the likely root cause. You can investigate by adding all of your subsystems to smartdashboard/shuffleboard and seeing what command is running long

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2024-04-03T12:37:20.997Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":85,"readers_count":84,"score":17.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":461154,"topic_slug":"pathplanner-auto-random-delays","display_username":"Fletch","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":9105,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3181/3015 Mentor | 213/1373 Alum | CSA/FTAA/Jack-of-all-Trades"},"post_url":"/t/pathplanner-auto-random-delays/461154/4","custom_user_title":"3181/3015 Mentor | 213/1373 Alum | CSA/FTAA/Jack-of-all-Trades","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3351278,"name":"Myer","username":"myer","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/myer/{size}/217120_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-03T12:41:45.640Z","cooked":"
isaacngkh:

Intake Down does not have time out and has to wait for PID to be at goal.

NewtonCrosby:

Intake Note will only end when the PID controller in your IntakeRotation subystem’s PID controller is with 1.5 degrees of the setpoint.

Both of these commands end in teleop as soon as they are expected to, since it would be quite obvious if they didn’t (the intake would run itself into the robot and destroy itself). I heavily doubt that Intake Up or Intake Down are the reasons for delays since these commands work completely fine in teleop and are the same commands declared in NamedCommands.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2024-04-03T12:41:45.640Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":2,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":78,"readers_count":77,"score":30.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":461154,"topic_slug":"pathplanner-auto-random-delays","display_username":"Myer","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":64553,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"1350 | Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/pathplanner-auto-random-delays/461154/5","custom_user_title":"1350 | Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3351296,"name":"NewtonCrosby","username":"NewtonCrosby","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/ed8c4c/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-04-03T12:59:38.360Z","cooked":"

You only have two options, it’s either the FollowPath command from PathPlanner didn’t end, or your _Intake Note _ command didn’t end.

It’s an easy experiment to try. As stated, put a timeout on your Intake Note command and see if the delay goes away or not. If the delay persists, then you know that there’s something wrong with your FollowPath command trying to go from MiddleSpeakerToNote.

When you run Intake Note in teleop, are you running it under the same conditions as you are in auto? Meaning, are you running it while trying to execute the FollowPath command? You could easily compose the same ParallelCommandGroup that Pathplanner is creating in the auto by just stating:

new IntakeNote(...).alongwith(new FollowPath("MiddleSpeakerToNote")

Put that on a dashboard, or bind it to a button. See if it still works in teleop. Though, the other troubleshooting is much easier, just add a timeout to the Intake Note named command and see if the delay changes.

Edit to add:
There is a third option, it could be that your ARTSA command is somehow taking 5 seconds to start to do anything that you recognize as it running. That is a less likely option (I believe).

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2024-04-03T13:08:59.095Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":71,"readers_count":70,"score":29.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":461154,"topic_slug":"pathplanner-auto-random-delays","display_username":"NewtonCrosby","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":31346,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/pathplanner-auto-random-delays/461154/6","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3351301,"name":"Basel Alghanem","username":"Basel_A","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/basel_a/{size}/65204_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-03T13:04:53.773Z","cooked":"

I’ve heard of some teams experiencing weird delays due to replanning. You could try passing in a Replanning Config that’s always false (but definitely undo it if it doesn’t fix your issue).

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2024-04-03T13:04:53.773Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":64,"readers_count":63,"score":32.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":461154,"topic_slug":"pathplanner-auto-random-delays","display_username":"Basel Alghanem","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":12479,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/pathplanner-auto-random-delays/461154/7","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3351310,"name":"Isaac","username":"isaacngkh","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/i/e9a140/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-04-03T13:21:25.463Z","cooked":"

Are you sure they ended in teleop? Sometimes it is hard to tell if commands are not finishing in teleop because most commands wouldn’t affect the driving, and you can still schedule other commands even if previous commands haven’t ended.

I would do some print statements to see where the code is getting stuck at.

Screenshot 2024-04-03 at 10.33.04 AM1146×1478 70.7 KB

The way i like doing it is have 1 path for each time we shoot or pickup in a parallel along with a wait and then pickup or shoot.

it sounds like your intake command isnt finishing, so you can either add a timeout in your code, or make the parallel group a race group in path planner

Screenshot 2024-04-03 at 10.35.10 AM1074×146 20.1 KB

we use time outs in our code. for collecting i recommend using the until decorator for hasNote like this
Screenshot 2024-04-03 at 10.37.09 AM1220×138 22.9 KB

I have isolated the problem. The ARSTSA command is the one causing the delay, but the details are quite puzzling to me. The first time the command is run after a power cycle (or potentially a redeploy, I don’t quite remember), the command takes abnormally long, delaying for 3 or 4 seconds. Each time the command is run after this, the delay is gone and the angle change is instant.

I don’t quite know what the problem here is, my possible explanations currently are:

  • The command uses SmartDashboard in its execute, and the key is not published before the command runs once, causing a delay.
  • Something in the Camera subsystem is causing the delay, probably in getSpeakerTarget().
